title: Use active voice
description: Prefer active voice to make sentences direct and concise. Active voice identifies the actor and action clearly.

examples.incorrect: The document was approved by the manager.

title: Ensure subjectâ€“verb agreement
description: Match the subject and verb in number and person to maintain grammatical accuracy.

examples.incorrect: The results of the test is ready.
examples.correct: The results of the test are ready.

title: Use parallel structure in lists
description: In lists or series, keep all items in the same grammatical form to improve readability.

examples.incorrect: The application can scan documents, analyzing errors, and suggestions are given.
examples.correct: The application can scan documents, analyze errors, and give suggestions.

title: Avoid noun strings
description: Break up long strings of nouns with prepositions or hyphens to make the meaning clearer.

examples.incorrect: User manual style guide rule database
examples.correct: Database of user manual style guide rules

title: Place modifiers next to the words they modify
description: Avoid misplaced modifiers by positioning them directly next to the words they describe.

examples.incorrect: Click Save after reviewing the changes quickly.
examples.correct: After reviewing the changes, click Save quickly.

title: Avoid double negatives
description: Double negatives can confuse readers. Use a single, clear positive or negative statement.

examples.incorrect: You can't not submit the form.

title: Use the imperative mood for instructions
description: Write steps in the imperative mood to make them direct and actionable.

examples.incorrect: You will need to click the OK button.

title: Avoid overuse of pronouns without clear antecedents
description: Ensure pronouns clearly refer to the correct noun to avoid ambiguity.

examples.incorrect: When the user clicks the button, it opens.
examples.correct: When the user clicks the button, the dialog opens.

title: Keep sentence structure simple
description: Prefer short, direct sentences over complex ones to improve comprehension.

examples.incorrect: Due to the fact that the system was not configured properly, it resulted in unexpected downtime.
examples.correct: The system was misconfigured, causing downtime.

title: Use consistent verb tense within a section
description: Maintain the same verb tense to avoid confusing the reader.

examples.incorrect: The program starts, then it was loading the configuration.
examples.correct: The program starts, then loads the configuration.

title: Avoid dangling participles
description: Ensure participial phrases clearly refer to the subject of the sentence.

examples.incorrect: After reviewing the report, the conclusions were unclear.
examples.correct: After reviewing the report, the manager found the conclusions unclear.

title: Avoid excessive nominalization
description: Turn nouns back into verbs where possible to make writing more active and concise.

examples.incorrect: The implementation of the feature was completed.

title: Avoid unnecessary auxiliary verbs
description: Remove unnecessary helping verbs to make sentences more concise.

examples.incorrect: The program is able to display the report.

title: Avoid repetitive sentence structures
description: Vary sentence structures to maintain reader engagement and improve flow.

examples.incorrect: The program loads data. The program checks for errors. The program generates a report.
examples.correct: The program loads data, checks for errors, and generates a report.

title: Use proper agreement between pronouns and antecedents
description: Pronouns should agree with their antecedents in number and gender.

examples.incorrect: Each user must log out when they finish.
examples.correct: Each user must log out when finished.
